TopicTitle: Game crashes when going to loading screen

Articles.Content:
Heyas,

like the topic says the game crashes after a while when i try to change to another screen. sometimes it happens when i leave the VAB on the first time... sometimes i can play for 10 minutes and game crashes on changing from another screen... i use several mods, all has been fine. than i added 3 mods and game started crashes.. even after removing the mods and new installation of the game didnt change anything. and the mods are all up to date except "ALCOR".. but ALCOR was one of the mods that i used befor crashing started...

so i dont really know what the problem is, i hope i can get some help here

output_log.txt

mod list

i hope the screenshot of my installed mods is helpfull

Edited October 22, 2014 by blutm8
That does not appear to be a complete output log. Seems cut off.

output_log.txt updated from newer crash

there seems to be a problem with direct x or grafics driver if i am right.. but i updated both to the latest version today, just to be sure
I know b9 crashes mine unless the graphics are turned down.
The current log shows you alt-tabbed out of KSP very soon into the loading process, and nothing after that until you quit KSP normally--no crash at all.

Unrelated problem

//Delete this, please.

Edited October 24, 2014 by Redhotita1
Offtopic

The current log shows you alt-tabbed out of KSP very soon into the loading process, and nothing after that until you quit KSP normally--no crash at all.

no i dont. i start the game, wait until main menu, load a game and after a while it crashes. so.. when the log says i alt+tab while loading screen... what might that be?

HandleD3DDeviceLost

HandleD3DDeviceLost: still lost

Skipped frame because GfxDevice is in invalid state (device lost)

That line in your log says your KSP is not the active window. I don't see any crash in the log file either.
Redhotita1, I suggest starting a new thread as your situation seems entirely unrelated.

HandleD3DDeviceLost

HandleD3DDeviceLost: still lost

Skipped frame because GfxDevice is in invalid state (device lost)

That line in your log says your KSP is not the active window. I don't see any crash in the log file either.

well but KSP IS the active window, the whole time

Then perhaps you're getting the log from a different install, or turned logging off and so it's an old log? Because the only time that gets put in the log is if:

1. you're running KSP fullscreen AND

2. It's not in focus
